Author: snowdamn#2414
Content: sucks to be ABC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: well its not a checkpoint every 10 blocks, just that reorgs more than 10 blocks are not allowed

Author: CryptoNinjaa#5350
Content: Something happened with those 2 chains yesterday evening. I saw exact same blocks from bch in sv and then sv confirmed a new sv block on top. not sure who was trying what but they tried something lol

Author: CryptoNinjaa#5350
Content: it was shortly after sv got ahead of abc

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there is no "ahead" or "behind" when they are two different chains

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this has been the case since the first incompatible block

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this whole "battle to the end" is nonsense rhetoric

Author: CryptoNinjaa#5350
Content: So what can craig actually do then? because from what he was saying he needs to be higher to cause reorgs?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: either chain can go 1000 blocks ahead with 100x the hashrate, but still the other chain will exist

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: whatever state of SV is totally irrelevant to the ABC chain, since they are different chains now

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: imaging the old BCH chain trying to overwrite the BTC chain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: how can it?

Author: CryptoNinjaa#5350
Content: i was thinking they were still compatible to each other and cause problems

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: they are different chains with different rules

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes, they can still cause tx replay issues, but that is a totally different matter

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: nothing to do with the blockchain reorg

Author: CryptoNinjaa#5350
Content: that is what he is trying to do. he said any exchange using abc would suffer tx issues

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that can be the case regarless of hashrate, height, etc

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is what happens when non-technical people start using technical buzzwords

Author: CryptoNinjaa#5350
Content: what do you think was going on last night then? 2 bchabc blocks on the sv chain ?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that seemed to be just an ordinary small reorg that happens all the time, even on BTC

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: why do you say they were abc blocks on sv chain?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: if they are valid sv blocks, they are sv blocks

Author: CryptoNinjaa#5350
Content: ok - just thought it was strange for 2 seperate chains to have exactly the same txs in blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: transactions are independent of blocks

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this is the replay issue

Author: CryptoNinjaa#5350
Content: so they were trying a replay attack then you think

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think it is dangerous to try to determine intent when you dont know whose tx it is

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: SV has created uncertainity (unsubstantiated) about the blockchain immutability and by injecting silly technical "attacks" into the realm of shouting matches, triggered the recent bear attack. the non-technical (vast majority) of big investors all got nervous about this crypto thing. All based on the silly notion that SV can somehow overwrite the ABC chain if it gets more hashpower.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is like worrying that LTC will overwrite BTC if it gets enough hashrate

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: technical nonsense

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but the tx replay makes for a real technical issue, so therefore all technical issues raised might be true, right?

Author: CryptoNinjaa#5350
Content: Thanks for explaining then i was under the impression craig could try to destroy bch.

Author: CryptoNinjaa#5350
Content: the ltc trying to  re writing btc explains it better for me

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you and many others. and if BCH can be destroyed, then maybe BTC can be too.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: that is what we see playing out in the markets

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but the only technical damange SV can do is by a tx on one chain being valid on the other chain

Author: CryptoNinjaa#5350
Content: so the best result is sv just goes away to become a 1 sat coin and people gain "coinfidence" again

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes
